title: Understanding Disenfranchised Grief
text: Disenfranchised grief occurs when a person's mourning is not recognized or validated by society. This can happen for various reasons, such as the nature of the loss or the relationship to the deceased.

title: Examples of Disenfranchised Grief
text: Consider situations where grief might not be acknowledged, such as the loss of a pet, a miscarriage, or the death of an ex-partner. These are often not given the same social support as other types of loss.

hintAnswer: a type of grief that is not openly acknowledged or socially supported
